resources.string: TalkBack is a screen reader primarily for people with blindness and low vision. It allows interaction with the device using spoken feedback.
"The next 3 lessons will teach you basic navigation gestures that TalkBack provides. To move to the next screen, scroll down with two fingers."
"Great! If you need to hear the previous screen again, you can swipe left. To exit the tutorial at any time, swipe right with two fingers. Swipe right to continue."
Finish button, double tap to activate.
"To learn more about TalkBack, visit this link on another device: g.co/weara11y."
Launch tutorial, double tap to activate.
If you have turned TalkBack on accidentally, turn it off by tapping Turn TalkBack off.
"Explore by touch lets you hear what's under your finger. Move your finger over the following items. After you have explored 4 items, the lesson will continue"
To activate the last item you heard, double tap anywhere. Find item 2 below and activate it.
To scroll through a vertical list, swipe up for next items or swipe down for previous items.
